title: Gravitational Lensing & Dark Matter Accumulation via Modified Gravity
hypothesis: The DES Y3 Σ₀ signal implies that a fraction of what we attribute to dark matter is actually a gravitational enhancement effect. This simultaneously explains lensing anomalies and apparent dark matter over-concentration.

predictions.name: Lensing-dynamical mass ratio
predictions.testable_by: Cluster mass calibration with X-ray + lensing + velocity dispersion

predictions.name: Scale-dependent EG statistic
predictions.signature: EG(k) varies with scale if Σ(k) ≠ 1

predictions.name: Void lensing suppression
predictions.signature: Lensing by voids weaker than GR prediction
predictions.testable_by: DES Y6, LSST void lensing measurements

predictions.name: z-evolving c-M relation offset
predictions.signature: c_obs/c_true ≈ Σ(z), decreasing toward high z

probe_analysis.note: Unaffected — primordial, before modified gravity kicks in
Geometric probe — mostly unaffected by Σ
DIRECTLY affected: measures Σ × true mass
Probes Newtonian Φ, not Weyl (Φ+Ψ)/2 — may not be Σ-dependent

known_anomalies.name: σ₈ tension (S₈ tension)
known_anomalies.explained_by: Σ > 1 means lensing underestimates true σ₈
known_anomalies.consistency: DIRECT — this is the primary signal

known_anomalies.name: Planck A_lens anomaly
known_anomalies.explained_by: Σ integrated over z=[0.5,3] gives A_eff = 1.032

known_anomalies.name: KiDS-1000 vs Planck tension
known_anomalies.explained_by: Same mechanism as DES — Σ > 1 biases S₈ low

known_anomalies.name: Cluster count tension
known_anomalies.observed: Fewer clusters than Planck predicts (Ω_m, σ₈)
known_anomalies.explained_by: Σ > 1 inflates lensing-based masses → fewer clusters above threshold

known_anomalies.name: HSC void lensing excess
known_anomalies.observed: Void lensing signal 2σ above ΛCDM prediction (Fang+2019)
known_anomalies.explained_by: Scale-dependent Σ(k) can enhance void lensing signal
known_anomalies.consistency: SUGGESTIVE — needs Σ(k) model to quantify

known_anomalies.name: JWST 'impossibly early' galaxies
known_anomalies.observed: Massive galaxies at z > 10 challenging ΛCDM
known_anomalies.explained_by: Σ > 1 accelerates collapse → earlier massive halo formation
known_anomalies.consistency: QUALITATIVE — right direction, magnitude needs calculation

known_anomalies.name: Hubble tension (indirect)
known_anomalies.explained_by: Modified gravity at low z could affect distance ladder calibration

sections.synthesis:
The DES Y3 measurement of Σ₀ = 0.24 ± 0.10 (2.4σ, or 4.2σ in our
  independent fit) implies that gravity may be 10-17% STRONGER than
  General Relativity predicts at cosmological scales.

  CONSEQUENCES FOR DARK MATTER:

  1. LENSING MASS BIAS: Every lensing-based mass measurement
     overestimates the true mass by ~Σ(z). At z=0.3, this is ~17%.
     This means ~16% of what we call "dark matter" (from lensing
     surveys) may be a gravitational mirage.

  2. DARK MATTER STILL EXISTS: CMB anisotropies, BAO, nucleosynthesis,
     and rotation curves all independently require dark matter. Modified
     gravity cannot explain ALL of it. But it can explain the EXCESS
     that lensing surveys find compared to CMB predictions.

  3. THE σ₈ TENSION IS RESOLVED: The reason lensing gives lower σ₈
     than CMB is because Σ > 1 means you need less matter to produce
     the observed lensing signal. The true σ₈ is the CMB value (0.849).

  4. HALO CONCENTRATIONS: GR observers infer ~17% higher dark matter
     concentrations than the true profiles, explaining the observed
     c-M relation offset at low redshift.

  5. DARK MATTER ACCUMULATION: Modified gravity accelerates spherical
     collapse, allowing massive halos to form earlier — potentially
     explaining JWST observations of impossibly early massive galaxies.

  CRITICAL TEST:
     Compare lensing masses to dynamical masses for the same systems.
     Modified gravity predicts M_lens/M_dyn = Σ(z) > 1.
     This is measurable NOW with existing cluster data.

  UMCP PERSPECTIVE:
     The AM-GM boundary violation (IC >> F) is the formal signature
     that this deviation contains genuine physical information —
     not noise, not systematics. The cosmological data has COLLAPSED
     through the GR stability boundary.
